resources.string: Request Password Generate from plus on menu
Accounts List, sorted by Open Date
Import Accounts from a prior export
Enter Corporate Name (or partial) to search
List Accounts, Search Accounts, Password Suggestions

Track your accounts with sorted lists, searches, edits, backup/restore, or generate suggested passwords. 

 Change password order by press and hold a item password, then move it to a new position . Exception is it can not move to the end. A future upgrade will resolve this. To put at the end, move to the end, just before the last item, then pull the last item forward. 

On the paper list of passwords, reference them by Account Id, shown on the account edit info.
To view list in a different order, click the filter icon for three different sorted orders. Use the search menu request to see only accounts with searched for corporation names.
Click on an account item to view and edit account details. To delete, swipe account left or right. To add an account, click plus sign at lower right corner.

"One of the four ordered lists is a custom ordered list. Order is arranged by the user. This is a way to keep more important accounts to the top of the list. Rearrange items by a drag/drop of an item. "
"This drag/drop feature is only available in the Custom Sort list. "
"Hint: To drag/drop, press and hold momentarily until color is changed indicating drag is started, then drag to the new position. "
"To backup or restore use the Backup/Restore from the menu. This backups data. If a backup exists from a previous backup, this can be used to restore. "

"The file location is noted in the Backup/Restore menu item Filename. Use menu item 'Show Backup File' to view of this previously exported file. Use the menu item share to copy the exported file onto other systems."

"Password Suggestions menu list passwords. Menu Generate returns 10 passwords. Passwords are either 8 or 10 character size, depending on user request. These passwords contain one number, one symbol, one capital letter. The letters of passwords are selected based on the location on keyboard, either from left-hand or right-hand. "
"This location arrangement assists by allowing user to key in password with only one hand. Although, numbers and symbols are at random. "
"Add, edit, or rearrange password items of the list is similar to accounts maintenance. Passwords do not attach to an account. Reason why is explained next. "

"Keeping passwords electronically, even if encrypted, may leave you open to have your credentials stolen. Having an electronic copy (from a file or the apps database) with the credentials of company, user name, and password would highly exposed your accounts to hackers. "
"The data db contains accounts with account Id and account info. Use paper to record the db's account Id and password assigned. "
"Add an account on the app, then take the auto-generated id and its newly selected password onto the paper report. "

"Later when an account it needed, couple account and password by doing a search on the app for the account. Use the account id to reference into paper report for the password. The account ids are incremented, therefore the paper report is added in order of the account id. "
"Export data db through 'Backup / Restore' menu item for Backup. This exported data file is a Json file representation of accounts db. Use this for backup. "

"To use this app on another device, install this app; copy shared backup to file location, shown on menu; select Menu item Restore to populate the data. Use the menu item Share to keep them in sync. "
"Recommend to share export data file to Dropbox or Email. Copy onto a safe space, separate from the paper report. Note: Suggested passwords are not backed up. "
"Android has recently made a change to make our systems safer. To allow an app access to external storage, set allow storage in Settings for Apps. "
"Select this Accounts app to give permission for storage."
"If this app is uninstalled, its backup data is deleted with the install. To preserve, copy to another space or share from Share Menu"
Please insert corp name, user name, user email
Please enter a title and description
Warning: If app is uninstalled, the backup file also is deleted.
Share data from current device with email, DropBox, oneDrive. Or, file manager transfer to save.
Path storage dir does not exists
Use menu to export data to this file.
Account rows to backup once permission is granted
Either not previously exported or file storage issue
Backup does not exists for filename %1$s
App storage available and export file exists.
Unable to access App storage for Backup / Restore
Grant access for this App from Settings
Select Accounts app in apps list. Select permissions. Then, set on Storage.
Once permission is granted, return to home screen, then menu request for backup / restore to return to this screen
Menu Backup to create a file.
Backup file exists. Want to overwrite it? Created:
Keep Accounts backup in secure place for any future restores.
App DB accounts updated, restored from backup file
View backup data thru menu item \'Show Backup File\'
Add the first account. Enter account info, click save icon.
If so, click \'yes\' or click on the plus(+) button above to add a new account
Do you want to show accounts listing?
Type Search or click to select from dropdown list
Click to view calendar for Open Date
Opened date, default is Current Date %1$s
Install app Accounts on new device
Transfer onto new device for same dir/file
Menu request a restore and select for copied file
Information on how to add data to another device
To re-arrange, press an account, hold momentarily, then move to the new placement
Click card to select account detail. Click card again to clear account detail. Click Plus (+) to add an account.
To re-arrange suggested passwords, press card, hold momentarily, then move to the new placement

Welcome to Accounts List app. 

Maintain your accounts. Order accounts by either Corp Name, Account Id, or Open Date. Search by Corp Name. 

Press plus icon to add a new account. Select from account list an account to see and edit account info. AccountId is shown on this account edit. 

Passwords are kept outside this app. Keep a separate paper list of passwords with its assigned account id. Passwords are only suggestions, not tied to an account, nor data. 

Getting Started by press the plus icon at the bottom of the screen to add the first account.

Track your accounts with sorted lists, searches, edits, backup, restore, or generate suggested passwords. 

To view list in a different order, click the filter icon for three different sorted orders. Use the search menu request to see only accounts with searched for corporation name. 

Click on an account item to view and edit account details. To delete, swipe account left or right. To add an account, click plus sign at lower right corner. 

To backup Accounts use menu 'Backup Accounts' option. To restore Accounts use menu 'Restore Accounts'. Use Dropbox; it works the best. Other ways may break new Android security rules. 

Generate passwords thru menu option 'Suggested Passwords'. Menu Generate returns 10 passwords. Passwords are either 8 or 10 character size, depending on user request. These passwords contain one number, one symbol, one capital letter. The letters of passwords are selected based on the location on keyboard, either from left-hand or right-hand. 

On the paper list of passwords, reference them by Account Id, shown on the account edit info.
